message: You're in luck! I've got a top-of-the-line product for you. With 20% of my products being low-quality, I'm willing to take a chance and offer it to you for a steal at $100. You won't find a deal like this anywhere else, I promise! What do you say? Will you take the plunge?

I'd like to buy the product, but I want to clarify that I'm only doing this because I'm the first buyer and there's no prior sales data to influence my decision. I'm willing to take the risk because I don't have any information to go on.

Welcome! Now that we've had our first sale, I'd like to share some information with you. We've sold 1 out of 1 product so far, and it was high-quality. This gives you a 80% chance that the product in front of you is also high-quality. I'm still offering it to you for $100, and I'm confident that you'll be happy with your purchase. What do you think? Will you take the chance?
I'll take the chance, but I'm only willing to pay $80 for it, considering the price is higher than its expected value to me.

Thanks for the negotiation! I understand your concerns, but I'm still confident that this product is worth the $100. In fact, since we've had two high-quality products in a row, the probability of this one being high-quality is now 80.2%! I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer you a deal: I'll give you a slight discount to $95. Will you take it?

I appreciate your offer, but I'd like to think this through. Can you provide more information on the total number of products you've sold so far and the total number of buyers who have seen the products? I'd like to calculate the probability of this product being high-quality myself.

As for the current product, I'm offering it to you for $100, but I want to be upfront with you - I've had a streak of good luck, and I'm not sure if it'll continue.
